meanings.definition: Cause to lose enthusiasm and initiative.
meanings.sent1: Constant criticism can stultify a person's motivation to try new things.
meanings.sent2: The monotonous routine at work often stultifies employees' creativity.
meanings.sent3: The strict rules in the game seemed to stultify the players, making them hesitant to take risks.
meanings.sent4: The oppressive heat seemed to stultify any desire for adventure in the travelers.
meanings.sent5: The lack of support from the team can stultify even the most ambitious goals.

meanings.definition: Make someone or something seem foolish or absurd.
meanings.sent1: His attempt to fix the broken vase only stultified the situation further.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's jokes sometimes stultify the audience instead of making them laugh.
meanings.sent3: The mismatched outfit she wore unintentionally stultified her fashion sense.
meanings.sent4: The exaggerated gestures of the actor stultified the seriousness of the scene.
meanings.sent5: The illogical argument only served to stultify his credibility in the debate.
